thread.title: Government Lifeline Isn’t Saving India’s State-Run Banks

author: Manju Dalal
title: Government Lifeline Isn’t Saving India’s State-Run Banks
text: Nearly six months after India threw a $32 billion lifeline to its state-run banks, many are still doing poorly, a troubling sign for the economy. In coming weeks, state-run banks will report results for the financial year ended March 31, and some analysts are forecasting record losses, the result of souring corporate loans and falling   WSJ City: U.S. Plans to Escalate Trade Pressure on China, LSE Names Goldman Banker CEO Next WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Consumer Spending, VC, Cults
